titles.title: Expressing the sense of the Congress regarding terms of office for Members of the Congress.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.
Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights.

bill.summary: 1/21/1993--Introduced. Expresses the sense of the Congress that: (1) the terms of office for Members of the House of Representatives should be increased from two to four years; (2) elections for Representatives should be held during the presidential election; (3) Representatives should be limited to three consecutive terms of office, but should be eligible for reelection after an absence from the House of at least four consecutive years; and (4) Senators should be limited to two consecutive terms of office, but should be eligible for reelection after an absence from the Senate of at least four consecutive years.
